title: Can stigmata be induced by suggestion and what does it reveal about the nature of these phenomena?
first_phrase: This text describes experiments involving the suggestion of stigmata on a hystero-epileptic subject by hypnosis practitioner Théodore Focachon. In one experiment, Focachon creates a wound on the subject's arm using a strip of marshmallow and guides it to close and open at will, causing the wound to bleed on command. The author, Victor Meunier, introduces the article by recounting the source of the information and drawing attention to the scientific interest of the experiments. The text also includes information about the author's own work in somnambulism, the discovery of a parasitic cyst in a patient's liver, and the use of suggestion to heal various ailments without drugs.
